Title: Higher billing rates drive US law firm growth as bonus season looms
Short Description: Large U.S. law firms are entering year-end bonus season after growing their revenues close to 5% on average through the third quarter, buoyed by fast-growing lawyer billing rates that have helped offset expenses, analysts at Wells Fargo said this week.

Title: US regulators push Wells Fargo to improve financial crime monitoring - WSJ
Short Description: U.S. regulators are pushing Wells Fargo to improve its monitoring system to detect criminal activity at the bank, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing people with knowledge of the matter.

Title: Wells Fargo to cut less than 50 investment banker jobs - source
Short Description: Wells Fargo has let go of less than 50 bankers from its corporate and investment banking unit as part of year-end pruning, a source familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

Title: Wells Fargo's cash sweep feature faces SEC investigation
Short Description: Wells Fargo's cash sweep options for investment advisory clients is being investigated by the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), the bank disclosed in a regulatory filing.

Title: Wells Fargo lifts interest income forecast as profit exceeds estimates
Short Description: Wells Fargo beat analysts' third-quarter profit estimates and raised its annual forecast for income from interest payments on Friday, as customers paid more to borrow.

Title: Wells Fargo rolls out financial planning tool to almost 70 million customers
Short Description: Wells Fargo will expand access to a financial planning tool to its nearly 70 million customers after initially offering it to wealth clients earlier this year, the bank said on Thursday.

Title: Wells Fargo sells $2 billion of private equity investments
Short Description: Wells Fargo said on Friday it had sold about $2 billion of its private equity investments as the bank aims to sharpen focus on its core businesses.

Title: Wells Fargo sells $2 bln of private equity investments
Short Description: Wells Fargo said on Friday it had sold about $2 billion of its private equity investments to a group of buyers that included AlpInvest Partners and Lexington Partners. (Reporting by Niket Nishant in Bengaluru; Editing by Shounak Dasgupta)

Title: Centerbridge teams up with Wells Fargo to launch direct-lending fund
Short Description: Private equity firm Centerbridge Partners is launching a direct-lending fund with backing from Wells Fargo , the companies said on Tuesday.

Title: Former Wells Fargo executive avoids prison in fake-accounts scandal
Short Description: The former head of Wells Fargo's retail bank on Friday avoided prison time after pleading guilty to an obstruction charge related to the bank's sweeping fake-accounts scandal.

Title: Former Wells Fargo exec Tolstedt avoids prison time in fake-accounts scandal - WSJ
Short Description: A former Wells Fargo executive Carrie Tolstedt would not serve prison time for her role in the bank's fake-accounts scandal, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday.

Title: Wells Fargo CFO expects more layoffs ahead
Short Description: Wells Fargo could see its headcount decline further as it aims to improve efficiency, Chief Financial Officer Mike Santomassimo said on Tuesday.

Title: Wells Fargo's William Daley to retire as vice chairman of public affairs
Short Description: Wells Fargo said on Thursday that William Daley would retire as vice chairman of public affairs at the end of the year.

Title: Wells Fargo vice chairman of public affairs Daley to retire
Short Description: Wells Fargo said on Thursday the bank's vice chairman of public affairs, William Daley, will retire at the end of this year. (Reporting by Pritam Biswas in Bengaluru)

Title: Wells Fargo hires Ford from Credit Suisse as head of equity capital markets
Short Description: Wells Fargo hired former Credit Suisse banker Jill Ford as its head of equity capital markets, the bank said in a statement.

Title: Wells Fargo to pay $35 million penalty over excessive fees, SEC says
Short Description: Wells Fargo has agreed to pay a $35 million civil penalty to settle U.S. charges that the company overcharged advisory fees, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) said on Friday.

Title: Wells Fargo defeats shareholder lawsuit over fake job interviews
Short Description: Wells Fargo won the dismissal of a lawsuit accusing the fourth-largest U.S. bank of defrauding shareholders by touting its commitment to hiring diversity while its managers were conducting sham interviews of non-white and female job candidates.

Title: Wells Fargo hires Credit Suisse veteran as head of financial sponsors
Short Description: U.S. bank Wells Fargo said on Monday Malcolm Price has joined its corporate and investment bank (CIB) as the head of financial sponsors, after 35 years at Credit Suisse.

Title: Wells Fargo pledges $60 million for worker re-entry program
Short Description: Wells Fargo on Wednesday said it may commit $60 million to Concordance, a nonprofit organization that helps workers with criminal records re-enter the workforce.

Title: Wells Fargo expects to pay $1.8 billion to help refill FDIC fund
Short Description: Wells Fargo said on Tuesday it expects to pay $1.8 billion to help replenish a government deposit insurance fund that was drained of $16 billion this year after three banks collapsed.

Title: Wells Fargo warns capital rules will prompt it to rejig balance sheet
Short Description: Wells Fargo said on Tuesday that proposed U.S. capital rules could lead the bank to rejig its balance sheet.

Title: Wells Fargo's firearm policies under Texas AG scrutiny
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co's policies around the firearm industry are being probed by the Texas Attorney General's office, the company said in an emailed statement on Thursday.

Title: Wells Fargo approves new $30 billion share buyback program
Short Description: Wells Fargo said on Tuesday its board had authorized a new share buyback program of up to $30 billion.

Title: Wells Fargo raises outlook for interest income after profit surges 57% on higher rates
Short Description: Wells Fargo raised its annual forecast for net interest income (NII) after its profit surged 57% in the second quarter, sending shares up 4% in premarket trading.

Title: Wells Fargo promotes head of Native American banking to managing director
Short Description: Wells Fargo promoted Dawson Her Many Horses, head of Native American Banking, to managing director, one of the first enrolled tribal members to reach that rank at a major U.S. bank, the lender said on Monday.

Title: Wells Fargo CFO expects upside in net interest income
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co expects an upside in net interest income going ahead, Chief Financial Officer Mike Santomassimo said on Tuesday.

Title: Wells Fargo CEO says there will be losses in office loan portfolio
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co's Chief Executive Officer Charlie Scharf said on Wednesday that there will be losses in the office loan space but the lender was proactively managing its portfolio.

Title: Former Wells Fargo exec settles SEC fraud charges, to pay $3 million
Short Description: The former head of Wells Fargo & Co's retail bank agreed to pay a $3 million penalty to settle U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission fraud charges for misleading investors about sales practices used to inflate a performance metric, the SEC said on Tuesday.

Title: Wells Fargo to pay $1 billion to settle shareholder lawsuit over recovery from scandals
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co has agreed to pay $1 billion to settle a lawsuit accusing it of defrauding shareholders about its progress in recovering from a series of scandals over its treatment of customers.

Title: Wells Fargo shareholder proposal against supermajority voting structure 'too close to call'
Short Description: Vote count on a shareholder proposal at Wells Fargo & Co, asking for the removal of supermajority voting requirements at the bank, is "too close to call at this point", according to a preliminary tally on Tuesday.

Title: Wells Fargo profit rises as higher rates bolster interest income
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co's profit rose as it earned more from interest rate payments in the first quarter, helped by the U.S. Federal Reserve's tighter monetary policy, the lender reported Friday.

Title: Wells Fargo names Saul Van Beurden as CEO for consumer banking unit
Short Description: Wells Fargo has named Saul Van Beurden as the chief executive officer of its consumer and small business banking (CSBB) unit, effective May 15, it said in a statement on Thursday. (Reporting by Siddarth S in Bengaluru; Editing by Shailesh Kuber)

Title: Former Wells Fargo executive pleads guilty to obstructing bank examination, fined $17 mln in fake accounts scandal
Short Description: The former head of Wells Fargo's retail bank has pleaded guilty to obstructing a bank examination and will pay a banking regulator a $17 million fine for her role in the bank's sweeping fake accounts scandal.

Title: Wells Fargo lays off mortgage bankers - CNBC
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co laid off hundreds of mortgage bankers this week as part of its recent strategic shift, CNBC reported on Wednesday, citing people with knowledge of the matter. In an emailed statement to Reuters, Wells Fargo said there were "displacements" across its home...

Title: Wells Fargo agrees to pay $300 mln to settle with shareholders over auto insurance disclosures
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co agreed to pay $300 million to settle a shareholder lawsuit claiming the bank hid that it had pushed unnecessary insurance on auto loan customers, according to documents filed in U.S. court on Tuesday. (Reporting by Jody Godoy in Californi; Editing by Chizu...

Title: Wells Fargo profit falls on higher reserves
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co on Friday reported a decline in profit for the fourth quarter as it paid regulatory penalties and stockpiled money to prepare for soured loans against the backdrop of a weaker economy.

Title: U.S. CFPB orders Wells Fargo to pay $3.7 bln in penalties for mismanagement
Short Description: The U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) on Tuesday ordered Wells Fargo & Co to pay a penalty of $3.7 billion, citing widespread mismanagement of auto loans, mortgages and deposit accounts. (Reporting by Manya Saini in Bengaluru; Editing by Shailesh Kuber)

Title: Wells Fargo cuts hundreds of jobs in mortgage business - Bloomberg News
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co has cut hundreds of jobs in its mortgage business across the country, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday citing people familiar with the bank's plans.

Title: Wells Fargo under pressure from CFPB to pay over $1 bln in fine- Bloomberg News
Short Description: Wells Fargo is under pressure from the U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to pay more than $1 billion to settle a slew of investigations into ill-treatment of its customers, Bloomberg News reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Title: Wells Fargo says SEC is examining its hiring practices
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co said on Monday that the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has begun investigating its hiring practices, after the Department of Justice had opened a related probe.

Title: Wells Fargo profit falls on rising loan loss reserves
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co on Friday reported a decline in profit for the third quarter as the bank set aside more money in preparation for a hit from a potential economic slowdown.

Title: Wells Fargo customers reporting higher number of scams on payments platform Zelle, Senator Warren says
Short Description: The rate of fraud and scams reported by Wells Fargo & Co's customers on digital payments platform Zelle was more than double when compared with other banks, U.S. Senator Elizabeth Warren said in a letter to Wells Chief Executive Charles Scharf. (Reporting by Niket Nishant...

Title: Wells Fargo CFO says there will be stress as economy slows
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co is seeing loan growth moderating after strong growth so far this year and witnessing downward pressure on mortgage revenue as consumers feel the effect of higher interest rates, its chief financial officer said on Tuesday.

Title: Wells Fargo agrees to resolve federal agency's review of 401(k) plan
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co said on Monday it had reached an agreement with the U.S. Department of Labor regarding a review by the federal agency of certain 401(k) plan-related transactions. (Reporting by Niket Nishant in Bengaluru; Editing by Anil D'Silva)

Title: CORRECTED-UPDATE 2-Wells Fargo profit slumps on higher loan loss reserves, mortgage weakness
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co reported a 48% drop in quarterly profit on Friday as the bank set aside more funds to cover potential loan losses, while its mortgage lending business came under pressure from higher interest rates.

Title: Wells Fargo profit falls on rising loan loss reserves
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co reported a fall in second-quarter profit on Friday as the bank set aside more money to cover loans that could sour if the U.S. pandemic recovery gives way to a recession.

Title: Federal prosecutors open criminal inquiry of Wells Fargo’s hiring practices - NYT
Short Description: Federal prosecutors in New York have opened a criminal investigation into whether Wells Fargo & Co violated federal laws by conducting fake job interviews, the New York Times reported https://www.nytimes.com/2022/06/09/business/wells-fargo-fake-interviews-investigation.html...

Title: U.S. Senate banking panel urges Wells Fargo to fix banks' weaknesses - NYT
Short Description: The head of the U.S. Senate Banking Committee on Tuesday called on Wells Fargo & Co Chief Executive Charles Scharf to address "weaknesses" at the bank, including "governance, risk management, and hiring practices," the New York Times reported.

Title: Wells Fargo quarterly profit drops nearly 21%
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co reported a nearly 21% drop in first-quarter profit on Thursday, as rising inflation and interest rates, as well as worries over the economic impact of the Ukraine war dented its core businesses.

Title: Wells Fargo CEO Scharf's 2021 compensation up by $1 mln at $21.4 mln
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co Chief Executive Officer Charles Scharf's total compensation was $21.4 million for 2021, up from $20.4 million in 2020, the Wall Street bank disclosed in a regulatory filing on Monday. (Reporting by Niket Nishant in Bengaluru; Editing by Shailesh Kuber)

Title: Wells Fargo's head of communications, branding leaving bank
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co's head of communications and brand management, Barri Rafferty, is leaving the bank in May, a spokesperson confirmed on Wednesday.

Title: Wells Fargo announces $18 bln buyback plan, doubles dividend
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co said on Monday it planned to repurchase $18 billion worth of shares for the period between the third quarter of 2021 and the second quarter of 2022.

Title: Morgan Stanley boss acknowledges slow progress on diversity
Short Description: Morgan Stanley's (MS.N) efforts to improve the diversity of its workforce and senior management have not proceeded as quickly as Chief Executive James Gorman would have liked, he said in prepared testimony posted on Tuesday.

Title: Wall Street bank CEOs to tout COVID relief push, diversity efforts before Congress
Short Description: Wall Street bank chiefs will tout the role their institutions have played in getting the pandemic-hit U.S. economy back on track when they appear before Congress this week, but are likely to face tough questions on hot-button social and economic issues.

Title: After M&A boom via Zoom, dealmakers hit the road as COVID-19 subsides
Short Description: Investment bankers' business of putting together mergers and acquisitions (M&A) has never been stronger. Neither has their fear of missing out on meeting clients.

Title: MOVES Wells Fargo names Ulrike Guigui as head of payments strategy
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co (WFC.N) said on Monday consumer finance veteran Ulrike Guigui will become the head of payments strategy at the bank, starting June 1.

Title: Wells Fargo to onboard active cryptocurrency strategy for rich clients
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co said on Wednesday its investment institute is planning to evaluate and onboard an actively managed cryptocurrency strategy for its wealthy clients, the latest move by a major U.S. bank toward accepting digital currencies.

Title: S&P 500 flat as telecom weakness offsets strong retail earnings
Short Description: The S&P 500 wavered between slight gains and losses on Tuesday as a sharp decline in telecom stocks and weak housing starts data overshadowed better-than-expected earnings from Walmart and Home Depot.

Title: Buffett’s Berkshire buys Aon, slashes Chevron and Wells Fargo
Short Description: Berkshire Hathaway Inc (BRKa.N) said on Monday it has taken a $943 million stake in insurance brokerage Aon Plc (AON.N) and sold large portions of its investments in Chevron Corp (CVX.N) and Wells Fargo & Co (WFC.N).

Title: Berkshire sheds nearly all of Wells Fargo, a holding since 1989
Short Description: Berkshire Hathaway Inc (BRKa.N) has sold nearly all of its holdings in Wells Fargo & Co (WFC.N), as Warren Buffett abandoned a more than 31-year-old investment that had been among his most successful before the bank was felled by scandals for mistreating customers.

Title: Wells Fargo launches 10-year plan to boost banking inclusion for underserved communities
Short Description: Wells Fargo (WFC.N) has launched a 10-year commitment to help unbanked individuals in the United States gain access to affordable, mainstream bank accounts, the company said on Monday.

Title: JPMorgan, others discuss issuing credit cards to people with no credit scores - WSJ
Short Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co (JPM.N), Wells Fargo (WFC.N), U.S. Bancorp (USB.N) and other banks plan to share data on customers' deposit accounts to extend credit to people who have traditionally been barred from getting them, the Wall Street Journal reported.

Title: EXCLUSIVE Fed privately presses big banks on risks from climate change
Short Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve has asked lenders to start providing information on the measures they are taking to mitigate climate change-related risks to their balance sheets, according to four people with knowledge of the matter.

Title: Factbox: Global big banks plot back-to-office plans as vaccines roll out
Short Description: The biggest banks in the world plan to re-open their offices, emboldened by aggressive vaccination drives and falling COVID-19 cases in major financial hubs, after sending most employees home early last year to help stem the spread of the coronavirus.

Title: Wells Fargo says U.S. consumer watchdog has opened new probe on mishandling of accounts
Short Description: Wells Fargo and Co. is facing a new probe from the U.S. consumer watchdog over how it disclosed and assessed monthly fees on certain consumer bank accounts in 2016, the bank disclosed in a regulatory filing on Thursday.

Title: KPMG UK staff to work in offices up to four days a fortnight from June
Short Description: Accounting firm KPMG told its 16,000 UK staff on Wednesday that they will work in the office for up to four days in a fortnight starting next month under a hybrid working model drawn up after the recent decline in COVID-19 cases in the country.

Title: Goldman Sachs employees in U.S., UK to return to office by summer
Short Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc (GS.N) asked U.S.-based employees to return to working in the office by mid-June and in the United Kingdom to return by mid-July, according to a memo seen by Reuters.

Title: Nasdaq plunges more than 2% as investors dump growth stocks
Short Description: The Nasdaq fell more than 2% on Tuesday as steep declines in megacap growth stocks pushed Wall Street below record trading levels, with investors seeking shelter in more defensive parts of the market.

Title: U.S. Supreme Court refuses to revive Wells Fargo accounts scandal suit
Short Description: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday rebuffed a bid by current and former employees of Wells Fargo & Co (WFC.N) to revive a lawsuit over losses to their retirement plan following a scandal over fake accounts that rattled the bank in 2016 and led to billions of dollars in fines and penalties.

Title: Wells Fargo scores the latest narrow win for CEO pay
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co's (WFC.N) executive pay plan for 2020 received backing from only about 57% of investor votes on Tuesday, a narrow win for the company and the latest evidence of tougher scrutiny shareholders have put on CEO compensation this year.

Title: Goldman Sachs replenishes top ranks of consumer bank division
Short Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc (GS.N) is rehiring a former executive in its consumer bank division and promoting several others, as the company seeks to replenish its top leadership after several key departures in recent months.

Title: Investors turn to growth stocks' results after strong earnings start
Short Description: On the heels of blockbuster earnings from major U.S. banks, investors are focused on whether an upcoming batch of earnings from major technology-related companies can sustain the season's early momentum.

Title: U.S. banks deploy AI to monitor customers, workers amid tech backlash
Short Description: Several U.S. banks have started deploying camera software that can analyze customer preferences, monitor workers and spot people sleeping near ATMs, even as they remain wary about possible backlash over increased surveillance, more than a dozen banking and technology sources told Reuters.

Title: Wall St ends week positively; S&P 500, Dow hit record highs
Short Description: The three main Wall Street indexes ended Friday higher for the day and week, with the S&P 500 (.SPX) and the Dow (.DJI) breaking closing records, as investors took strong economic data and bank earnings as signs of momentum in the U.S. pandemic recovery.

Title: Dow hits milestone, S&P breaks record high on tech rally
Short Description: The Dow industrials (.DJI) closed above 34,000 for the first time on Thursday as the blue-chip benchmark and S&P 500 (.SPX) posted fresh record highs on a tech stock rally fueled by falling bond yields and strong March U.S. retail sales.

Title: Dow breaks 34k, S&P hits fresh record high on tech rally
Short Description: The Dow industrials (.DJI) closed above 34,000 for the first time on Thursday as the blue-chip benchmark and S&P 500 (.SPX) posted fresh record highs on a tech stock rally fueled by falling bond yields and strong March U.S. retail sales data.

Title: S&P 500, Dow extend record highs on tech stock gains
Short Description: The S&P 500 (.SPX) and the Dow industrials (.DJI) extended all-time highs on Thursday as falling bond yields and strong March U.S. retail sales data sparked buying of richly valued technology stocks.

Title: Bank CEOs to testify as U.S. Congress ramps up scrutiny of Wall Street
Short Description: The U.S. Congress will hold hearings next month with the chief executives of major Wall Street banks as Democratic lawmakers step up scrutiny of the role lenders have played in helping struggling Americans recover from the COVID-19 pandemic.

Title: World stocks rally as Treasury yields tumble
Short Description: World stock markets extended a five-day run of fresh highs on Thursday, fueled by upbeat earnings and strong U.S. economic data that herald a solid recovery ahead, while Russian markets tumbled at the prospect of the harshest U.S. sanctions in years.

Title: Citigroup profit jumps, plans Asia and EMEA exits as Fraser makes her mark
Short Description: Citigroup Inc (C.N) trounced first-quarter profit expectations, thanks to a rebound in the broader economy and a jump in investment banking activity, and said it will exit some overseas businesses as new chief executive Jane Fraser starts to make her mark on the country's third-largest lender.

Title: Technology stocks lead S&P 500, Dow to record highs
Short Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow hit record highs on Thursday as easing inflation concerns boosted demand for richly valued technology stocks, while upbeat earnings reports and strong March retail sales raised hopes of a broader economic rebound.

Title: World stocks stay high, Russia’s rouble buckles under sanctions stress
Short Description: World stocks were on course to extend a five-day run of record highs on Thursday, while Bitcoin took a breather after its latest surge and Russia’s markets tumbled at the prospect of the harshest U.S. sanctions in years.

Title: Asian shares defensive, dollar struggles near 1-mth lows
Short Description: Asian shares were on the backfoot on Thursday following mixed cues from Wall Street where a sharp sell-off in the largest bitcoin exchange Coinbase (COIN.O) hit tech shares while the dollar index struggled near one-month lows.

Title: Wall Street ends mixed despite bumper big-bank earnings
Short Description: Wall Street indexes closed mixed on Wednesday, with the Nasdaq Composite (.IXIC) and S&P 500 (.SPX)falling despite another record intraday high for the latter and big banks' stellar results on the first day of earnings season.

Title: Wall Street ends mixed despite bumper bank earnings
Short Description: Wall Street indexes closed mixed on Wednesday, with the Nasdaq Composite (.IXIC) and S&P 500 (.SPX)falling despite another record intraday high for the latter and big banks' stellar results on the first day of earnings season.

Title: S&P 500 dips off record high, Dow rises on bank earnings
Short Description: The S&P 500 (.SPX) dipped after hitting a record high for the fourth session in five and the Dow Industrials (.DJI) rose on Wednesday, as Wall Street banks kicked off earnings season with first-quarter numbers that lifted hopes for a strong corporate rebound.

Title: As bank earnings roll in, a mixed picture for loans
Short Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co (JPM.N), the largest U.S. bank and often heralded as a bellwether for the economy, on Wednesday reported an eye-popping increase in its profit for the first quarter.

Title: Wells Fargo starts to emerge from sales scandal as first-quarter profit jumps
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co (WFC.N) beat Wall Street profit expectations on Wednesday as it reduced bad loan provisions and reined-in costs, signaling the bank may finally be emerging from a sales practices scandal that has dogged it for nearly five years.

Title: Wells Fargo profit surges as bank commits less funds for potential bad loans
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co reported a strong rebound in first-quarter profit on Wednesday as the bank set aside less money to cover soured loans.

Title: JPMorgan profits on capital markets in a cash-flush economy
Short Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co's (JPM.N) first-quarter results on Wednesday laid bare the challenge big banks face in this phase of the pandemic, where stimulus programs have left individuals and businesses in good financial shape but so flush with cash that few of them need loans.

Title: S&P 500, Dow rise on boost from bank earnings
Short Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow rose on Wednesday after upbeat earnings reports from Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan boosted investor expectations of a strong rebound for corporate America amid swift COVID-19 vaccinations.

Title: Tech stocks push S&P 500 to record close, buoy Nasdaq
Short Description: The S&P 500 (.SPX) closed at another record high on Tuesday and the Nasdaq composite index jumped, as investors shook off concerns about the halt in Johnson & Johnson's COVID-19 vaccine rollout and strong U.S. inflation.

Title: Global stocks hit record after U.S. inflation data
Short Description: A gauge of global equity markets rose to record highs on Tuesday, led by surging technology-related stocks, as Treasury bond yields eased after U.S. consumer price data for March showed the pace of inflation was not rising wildly.

Title: S&P 500, Nasdaq up as tech stocks rise after J&J vaccine pause
Short Description: The S&P 500 hit a record high on Tuesday and the Nasdaq jumped as investors flocked to technology-related stocks after the United States' pause in the rollout of Johnson & Johnson's COVID-19 vaccine sparked fears of a delay in a broader economic rebound.

Title: Wall St ends lower as investors await earnings, inflation data
Short Description: The S&P 500 (.SPX) and Dow Jones industrial average (.DJI)ended lower on Monday, with investors waiting for cues from the upcoming corporate earnings season and a key inflation report later this week.

Title: S&P 500, Dow dip ahead of earnings, inflation data
Short Description:
The S&P 500 (.SPX)
                and Dow Jones industrial average (.DJI) dipped below record levels on Monday as investors paused ahead of the start of the corporate reporting season and a key inflation report later this week.

Title: Stocks slip from record peaks before earnings reports
Short Description: The dollar fell slightly on Monday and a gauge of global equity markets slid from record highs last week as investors wait to see whether an expected jump in U.S. earnings will justify stock prices already trading at very high premiums.

Title: S&P 500, Dow slip from record highs ahead of earnings, inflation data
Short Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow Jones indexes retreated from record levels on Monday, as investors geared up for the start of the corporate reporting season and a key inflation report later this week.

Title: Stocks sink as investors await earnings, U.S. data
Short Description: Global stock markets sank on Monday as investors waited to see whether U.S. earnings would justify sky-high valuations, while a rally in bonds could be tested by what should be strong readings for U.S. inflation and retail sales this week.

Title: Asia shares anxious for earnings season, U.S. data deluge
Short Description: Asian shares faltered on Monday as anxious investors wait to see if U.S. earnings can justify sky-high valuations, while a rally in bonds could be tested by what should be very strong readings for U.S. inflation and retail sales this week.

Title: Asia shares slip into earnings season, U.S. data deluge
Short Description: Asian shares faltered on Monday as investors wait to see if U.S. earnings can justify sky-high valuations, while bond markets could be tested by what should be very strong readings for U.S. inflation and retail sales this week.

Title: Asia off to cautious start ahead of earnings, U.S. data
Short Description: Asian shares started cautiously on Monday as investors wait to see if U.S. earnings can justify sky-high valuations, while bond markets could be tested by what should be very strong readings for U.S. inflation and retail sales this week.

Title: S&P 500, Dow climb for third day and close at records
Short Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow rose on Friday to close at record highs, posting a third straight weekly rise partly on a lift from growth stocks, with a late-day rally building gains ahead of quarterly earnings season next week.

Title: S&P 500, Dow climb for third day and close at records
Short Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow rose on Friday to close at record highs, posting a third straight weekly rise partly on lift from growth stocks, with a late-day rally building gains ahead of quarterly earnings season next week."

Title: Wall St Week Ahead With stocks at record highs, investors look to upcoming earnings
Short Description: Wall Street is kicking off a crucial reporting season as U.S. companies provide quarterly results a year after the coronavirus pandemic crippled the economy and as investors look for reasons to support a stock market at record highs.

Title: S&P 500, Dow at all-time high as banks, industrial rise
Short Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow hit record highs on Friday as economy-linked stocks including banks and industrials gained on optimism around strong U.S. economic growth.

Title: Analysis: Lebanon's woes push it to fringes of global finance system
Short Description: Foreign lenders including HSBC (HSBA.L) and Wells Fargo (WFC.N) are cutting ties with Lebanon's central bank, sources familiar with the matter told Reuters, underlining the country's international isolation as it reels from economic crisis.

Title: Wall St dips, with technology the biggest drag
Short Description: U.S. stocks ended down slightly on Tuesday, with investors selling tech-related growth shares after U.S. Treasury yields hit a 14-month high.

Title: Wall St dips, with tech-related names underperforming
Short Description: U.S. stocks ended down slightly on Tuesday, with investors selling tech-related growth shares after U.S. Treasury yields hit a 14-month high.

Title: S&P 500 ends down slightly; tech trims losses as yields come off highs
Short Description: The S&P 500 ended down slightly on Tuesday, with investors selling tech-related growth shares following a rise in U.S. Treasury yields.

Title: Wall St drops as tech stocks hit by spike in yields
Short Description: Wall Street's main indexes slipped on Tuesday as investors pulled out of heavyweight tech-related stocks and flocked to undervalued banks and industrial stocks spooked by a new high in U.S. bond yields.

Title: Wells Fargo says no losses from Archegos downfall
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co (WFC.N) said on Tuesday it had a prime brokerage relationship with Archegos Capital and it did not experience any losses related to the closing of its exposure.

Title: Banks lead Wall Street lower on hedge fund default concerns
Short Description: Wall Street's main indexes fell on Monday after a surge in the previous session, as global banks said they faced potential losses of billion of dollars from a hedge fund's default on margin calls.

Title: 3 Archegos margin call share dump ripples across markets
Short Description: Nomura (8604.T) and Credit Suisse (CSGN.S) are facing billions of dollars in losses after a U.S. hedge fund, named by sources as Archegos Capital, defaulted on margin calls, putting investors on edge about who else might have been caught out.

Title: Wall Street set to slip as bank stocks fall on hedge fund default concerns
Short Description: U.S. stock index futures pointed to a lower open for Wall Street on Monday after a surge in the previous session, as global banks said they faced potential losses from a hedge fund's default on margin calls.

Title: S&P 500, Dow set to open higher on recovery hopes
Short Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow were set to open higher on Friday as investors bought undervalued energy and bank stocks betting on what is expected to be the fastest economic growth since 1984.

Title: U.S. bank profits may leap, then fade, as investors look under the hood
Short Description: Big U.S. banks are on track to produce blockbuster first-quarter profit gains, but enthusiasm might fade when investors look under the hood.

Title: Stocks rebound in late-day rally on Wall Street
Short Description: U.S. stocks rose in a late-day rally on Thursday as investors bought stocks likely to do well in the recovery and picked up beaten-down Apple and Tesla shares in anticipation that the U.S. economy grows at its fastest pace in decades this year.

Title: (OFFICIAL) Digital banking startup Greenwood raises $40 million from big banks
Short Description: Atlanta-based Greenwood, a digital banking startup designed for Black and Latino consumers and businesses, said on Thursday that it had raised $40 million from a host of U.S. financial institutions.

Title: Wells Fargo to sell corporate trust unit to Australia's Computershare for $750 mln
Short Description: Wells Fargo (WFC.N) on Wednesday said it will sell its corporate trust business to Australia's Computershare Ltd (CPU.AX) for $750 million, the latest move to unload assets and focus on main divisions since top boss Charles Scharf joined the bank in 2019.

Title: US STOCKS Wall Street retreats after solid start to March
Short Description: Wall Street's main indexes dropped on Tuesday after a strong start to March as bond yields pulled back from a one-year high, while investors also looked to cues on progress in the next round of fiscal stimulus.

Title: US STOCKS Nasdaq, S&P set to open lower as tech shares fall amid rising bond yields
Short Description: The Nasdaq and S&P 500 indexes were set to open lower on Thursday as heavyweight technology-related stocks remained under pressure with a rise in U.S. Treasury yields, while data showed weekly jobless claims fell more than expected.

Title: Wells Fargo sells asset management arm to private equity firms for $2.1 bln
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co (WFC.N) said on Tuesday it had agreed to sell its asset management business, which manages more than $603 billion on behalf of customers, to private equity firms GTCR LLC and Reverence Capital Partners for $2.1 billion.

Title: US STOCKS Nasdaq ends lower as tech slides; inflation concerns weigh
Short Description: The Nasdaq closed lower while the S&P 500 was little changed on Wednesday as investors rotated out of technology shares and concerns about inflation added some pressure on stocks.

Title: Wells Fargo wins Fed acceptance for overhaul plan tied to asset cap - Bloomberg News
Short Description: Fed officials have privately signaled to Wells Fargo & Co (WFC.N) that they have accepted its proposal for overhauling risk management and governance, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing people with knowledge of the matter.

Title: JP Morgan's board rejects switch to stakeholder-focused entity
Short Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co (JPM.N) CEO Jamie Dimon has led calls for companies to consider the needs of workers, communities and customers as well as those of shareholders.

Title: Wells Fargo CEO Scharf's pay drops nearly 12% in 2020
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co (WFC.N) Chief Executive Officer Charles Scharf's annual pay fell by about $3 million, or 12%, in 2020, a regulatory filing showed on Friday.

Title: U.S. private prison revenue under pressure from new Biden rules
Short Description: CoreCivic and the GEO Group, two of the largest U.S. private prison companies, could lose as much as a quarter of their revenue, about $1 billion a year between them, under new limits on the sector from President Joe Biden.

Title: Tesla bears suffer record short-sale loss in 2020 -S3 Partners
Short Description: Short bets on Tesla Inc (TSLA.O) were the most unprofitable trade in 2020, as the electric automaker saw its shares surge over 740% en route to becoming the world's most valuable automaker.

Title: Morgan Stanley boosts targets after blowout trading quarter
Short Description: Morgan Stanley (MS.N) boosted both its short and long-term operating targets on Wednesday after coronavirus-induced volatility in financial markets helped the Wall Street bank post a quarterly profit that sailed past estimates.

Title: Morgan Stanley profit surges on trading strength
Short Description: Morgan Stanley (MS.N) posted a 57% rise in fourth-quarter profit on Wednesday, as the Wall Street bank's trading business benefited from coronavirus-induced volatility in financial markets.

Title: US STOCKS Wall St closes higher as Yellen backs more stimulus
Short Description: Wall Street's main indexes rose on Tuesday as U.S. Treasury Secretary nominee Janet Yellen advocated for a hefty fiscal relief package before lawmakers to help the world's largest economy ride out a pandemic-driven slump.

Title: US STOCKS Wall St rises as market anticipates additional U.S. stimulus
Short Description: Wall Street's main indexes rose on Tuesday as U.S. Treasury Secretary nominee Janet Yellen advocated for a hefty fiscal relief package before lawmakers to help the world's largest economy ride out a pandemic-driven slump.

Title: Under govt pressure, big U.S. lenders rush to launch more pandemic loans-sources
Short Description: The U.S. government is pressuring large lenders to go live this week with another round of a key federal pandemic loan program despite many unresolved issues, sparking an industry scramble to get lending platforms ready, five people familiar with the discussions said.

Title: US STOCKS Wall St rises as Yellen speaks; spotlight on earnings
Short Description: Wall Street's main indexes rose on Tuesday on positive earnings updates from major U.S. lenders, while Treasury Secretary nominee Janet Yellen advocated for a hefty fiscal relief package before Senate lawmakers to ride out the world's largest economy from a pandemic-driven slump.

Title: US STOCKS Wall Street closes lower as banks, energy shares tumble
Short Description: Wall Street's main indexes finished lower on Friday, with the biggest drag coming from big U.S. banks after their earnings reports, while the energy sector was weighed down by a regulatory probe into Exxon Mobil Corp (XOM.N).

Title: Dollar rises despite drop in yields; data, lockdowns weigh on stocks
Short Description: Stocks and oil prices fell on Friday pressured by intensifying lockdowns and weak U.S. retail sales data, while the dollar was on track to post its strongest week in over two months.

Title: Wells Fargo records rare profit beat as credit costs fall
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co (WFC.N) posted a small rise in quarterly profit on Friday that beat Wall Street estimates, as stabilizing credit costs helped buffer historic near-zero interest rates meant to prop up the ailing economy during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Title: JPMorgan trims loan reserves on hopes for recovery
Short Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co (JPM.N) reported a better-than-expected quarterly profit on Friday as it released some of the cash it had built up against coronavirus-driven loan losses, although the bank cautioned that demand for loans was likely to remain sluggish this year.

Title: US STOCKS Wall Street drops as big banks fall after results
Short Description: Wall Street's main indexes dropped on Friday, weighed down by losses in major U.S. lenders after their earnings reports, while incoming President Joe Biden's $1.9 trillion stimulus plan also sparked fears of an increase in corporate taxes.

Title: Asia shares edge higher as Biden unveils $1.9 trln U.S. stimulus plan
Short Description: Asian shares edged up near record highs on Friday after U.S. President-elect Joe Biden proposed a $1.9 trillion stimulus plan to jump-start the world's largest economy and accelerate its response to COVID-19.

Title: Asia shares inch up as U.S. stimulus hopes boost sentiment
Short Description: Asian shares rose on Friday, brushing off a late Wall Street dip as expectations of large U.S. stimulus under President-elect Joe Biden shored up sentiment while oil prices perked up on upbeat Chinese trade figures.

Title: US STOCKS Wall St ends lower as investors weighed stimulus hopes and bleak jobs data
Short Description: Wall Street closed lower on Thursday after making a u-turn toward the end of the session as reports emerged about U.S. President-elect Joe Biden's pandemic aid proposal following earlier data that showed a weakening labor market.

Title: US STOCKS Wall Street ends lower as investors weigh stimulus hopes and bleak jobs data
Short Description: Wall Street closed lower on Thursday as hopes for fresh fiscal stimulus ahead of President-elect Joe Biden's pandemic aid proposal were pitted against a weakening labor market.

Title: US STOCKS Wall Street rises as stimulus hopes counter bleak jobs data
Short Description: Wall Street gained ground on Thursday, with the Dow and Nasdaq briefly touching record highs, as investors' hopes for fresh fiscal stimulus ahead of President-elect Joe Biden's pandemic aid proposal were countered by weakening labor market conditions.

Title: Wells Fargo CEO to unveil cost-cutting plan
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co (WFC.N) Chief Executive Charlie Scharf will give investors more details on his long-awaited turnaround plan for the scandal-plagued bank this week.

Title: Analysis: Digital banks gain U.S. customers during pandemic, thanks to early deposits
Short Description: Digital banks including Chime, Varo and Current have won over more U.S. customers during the coronavirus pandemic by processing stimulus payments quickly, setting them apart from traditional banks and generating valuable word-of-mouth referrals.

Title: US STOCKS Wall St edges higher with eyes on earnings season; GM soars
Short Description: Wall Street's main indexes inched higher on Tuesday ahead of the start of corporate America's reporting season that could signal a rebound in earnings, while General Motors' shares jumped on launching an electric delivery vehicle business.

Title: Stocks pause for breath as bond selloff extends
Short Description: Stocks took a breather on Tuesday, easing from record highs as political turmoil in Washington and rising coronavirus cases gave pause, though a selloff in U.S. Treasuries extended as investors reckon on a big spending government.

Title: Asia shares mostly lower amid rising coronavirus cases, Washington turmoil
Short Description: Asian stocks were mostly lower on Tuesday, tracking Wall Street declines as political turmoil in Washington and rising coronavirus cases worldwide weighed on sentiment ahead of the start of the quarterly earnings season.

Title: US STOCKS Wall St ends lower with Washington turmoil, earnings in view
Short Description: Wall Street's main indexes closed lower on Monday as investors took some profits after last weeks' record levels while they waited for earnings season to begin and eyed events in Washington with trepidation.

Title: US STOCKS Wall St retreats with earnings, Washington in view
Short Description: Wall Street's main indexes slipped from record levels on Monday as investors took some profits as they waited for earnings season to begin and eyed events in Washington with caution.

Title: US STOCKS Wall St retreats from all-time highs after strong run; Twitter slumps
Short Description: Wall Street's main indexes slipped from record levels on Monday as investors locked in gains after a strong rally, with prospects of President Donald Trump's impeachment trial stoking fears of a delay in further pandemic relief.

Title: Stocks slip on virus fears, U.S. yields continue to climb
Short Description: Stocks came off record highs on Monday partly on caution over rising coronavirus cases globally while elevated Treasury yields continued to support the dollar, which touched its highest in two and a half weeks against a basket of peers.

Title: US STOCKS Wall St retreats from all-time highs after strong run; Twitter slumps
Short Description: Wall Street's main indexes slipped from record levels on Monday as investors locked in gains after a stellar vaccine and stimulus-fueled rally, while Twitter shares slumped following the permanent suspension of President Donald Trump's account.

Title: U.S. bank quarterly profits expected to fall again from pre-COVID levels
Short Description: When the biggest U.S. banks begin reporting fourth-quarter results on Friday some of the headlines could show profits plunged by as much as 40% from a year earlier, before the pandemic struck.

Title: Factbox: What's new in the next round of U.S. small business pandemic loans
Short Description: The Small Business Administration launches on Monday more Paycheck Protection Program loans to help small businesses weather the coronavirus pandemic. Congress last month approved $284 billion in new funds for the forgivable loans which are distributed by lenders on behalf of the government, adding to the $525 billion distributed last year.

Title: GLOBAL MARKETS World shares down from record highs as COVID-19 cases top 90 million
Short Description: World shares slipped from record highs on Monday as caution over rising coronavirus cases saw some profit-taking from investors, while Treasury yields remained close to 10-month highs, indicating expectations for global reflation from anticipated U.S. fiscal stimulus.

Title: GLOBAL MARKETS Asia stocks near highs, yields up on U.S. stimulus risk
Short Description: Asian shares paused near historic highs on Monday while Treasury yields were at a 10-month top as "trillions" in new U.S. fiscal stimulus plans were set to be unveiled this week, stoking a global reflation trade.

Title: GLOBAL MARKETS Asia stocks off highs, yields up on looming U.S. stimulus

Title: GLOBAL MARKETS Asia stocks hold near highs, yields up on U.S. stimulus plans

US STOCKS Wall St at record levels after Trump signs fiscal aid bill

Short Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow scaled record highs on Wednesday as hopes of a working COVID-19 vaccine and fresh economic stimulus before the end of the year lifted demand for economically sensitive energy and financial shares.

Title: Wells Fargo swings to loss on higher provisions to cover soured loans

Title: Wells Fargo likely to eliminate 2016 bonuses for top executives-WSJ

Title: Head of fraud ring targeting Wells Fargo accounts gets 7-year sentence
Short Description: By Karen Freifeld A California man behind an identity theft ring that stole more than half a million dollars from Wells Fargo Bank customers was sentenced on Thursday to over seven years in prison, U.S. prosecutors said.

Title: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-FINRA fines Wells Fargo, others $14 mln for records' changeable format
Short Description: The Financial Industry Regulatory Authority said it fined several Wells Fargo & Co businesses, RBC Capital Markets, LPL Financial and others a combined $14.4 million on Wednesday for record-keeping problems that may have allowed company and customer documents to be altered.

Title: FINRA fines Wells Fargo, others $14 mln for records' changeable format
Short Description: The Financial Industry Regulatory Authority said it fined several Wells Fargo & Co businesses, RBC Capital Markets, LPL Financial and others a combined $14.4 million on Wednesday for record-keeping problems that may have allowed company and customer documents to be altered.

Title: SEC asks Wells Fargo to explain loan accounting practices

Title: U.S. regulator launches hotline for ex-Wells Fargo bankers fired during scandal
Short Description: A private U.S. regulator launched a hotline on Friday to hear from ex-Wells Fargo & Co employees who were fired for allegedly opening unauthorized accounts after news reports that the bank may have retaliated by terminating whistleblowers in the scandal.

Title: U.S. regulator set to fail Wells Fargo on community lending test -sources
Short Description: A U.S. bank regulator is ready to fail Wells Fargo on a national scorecard for community lending, sources familiar with the decision said on Wednesday, in a move that could limit near-term expansion for the bank.

Title: Wells Fargo says general counsel postpones planned retirement
Short Description: James Strother, Wells Fargo & Co's general counsel, who had originally planned to retire at year-end, will stay on indefinitely in the position to deal with the fallout from a sales scandal, according to a bank spokesman.

Title: U.S. lawmaker Warren slams Wells Fargo over arbitration position
Short Description: Massachusetts Democratic Senator Elizabeth Warren on Monday criticized Wells Fargo & Co's decision to require customers affected by its unauthorized accounts scandal to go through arbitration rather than allowing them to sue.

Title: Wells Fargo payouts should be halted in wake of ruling-U.S. lawmakers
Short Description: The U.S. government should go after payouts to former Wells Fargo & Co executives involved in a scandal over unauthorized accounts now that a federal regulator has said it has the power to do so, lawmakers said on Monday.

Title: U.S. regulator reverses course, tightens controls on Wells Fargo after scandal
Short Description: A leading U.S. bank regulator on Friday reversed course and positions the agency to claw back pay of former executives at Wells Fargo & Co after a phony-accounts scandal.

Title: U.S. SEC questioned Wells Fargo about cross-selling in 2014
Short Description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission raised questions about Wells Fargo & Co's aggressive cross-selling in late 2014, according to regulatory paperwork, almost two years before officials settled with the bank for opening phony accounts.

Title: Wells Fargo account scandal extends to small business -U.S. senator
Short Description: The scandal over improper sales practices at Wells Fargo & Co extended to thousands of small-business owners, according to a U.S. lawmaker, raising questions about the scope the bank's issues with unauthorized accounts.

Title: Wells Fargo workers say they were fired for reporting "gaming" of sales quotas
Short Description: At least five Wells Fargo employees have sued the bank or filed complaints with regulators alleging that they were fired after reporting the opening of customer accounts without their permission, according to a Reuters review of lawsuits and complaints to the U.S. Labor...

Title: Wells Fargo scandal reignites debate about big bank culture
Short Description: In the aftermath of the 2008 financial crisis, the banking industry sought to address an ethics crisis with surveys, town hall meetings, appointments of overseers and mechanisms for employees to report malfeasance.

Title: Wells Fargo launches investigation into retail banking sales practices
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co said on Tuesday that Chief Executive John Stumpf will forfeit unvested equity awards worth about $41 million and will not get a salary during an independent investigation into the bank's sales practices.

Title: U.S. Labor Dept launches review of all Wells Fargo complaints
Short Description: U.S. Labor Department Secretary Thomas Perez on Monday pledged to conduct a "top-to-bottom" review of all cases, complaints and other alleged violations that the department has received concerning Wells Fargo in recent years.

Title: Wells Fargo CEO resigns from San Francisco Fed's advisory council
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co Chief Executive John Stumpf, under fire over problematic sales tactics, resigned from the Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco's advisory council on Thursday.

Title: U.S. House panel to hold hearing on Wells Fargo accounts scandal
Short Description: The House of Representatives Financial Services committee plans to hold a hearing into Wells Fargo & Co next week after a scandal at the bank involving 2 million fake accounts that thousands of employees set up in customers' names.

Title: U.S. prosecutors investigate Wells Fargo's sales practices -source
Short Description: U.S. prosecutors have begun an investigation related to sales practices at Wells Fargo & Co that led the bank to agree to a $190 million settlement with regulators, a person familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Title: UPDATE 4-Wells Fargo profit falls as employee costs rise
Short Description: * Shares fall 2 pct (Adds details, CEO and analyst comments; updates shares)

Title: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Wells Fargo profit falls as expenses rise
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co, the largest U.S. mortgage lender, reported a 2.6 percent fall in quarterly profit as expenses rose and the bank set aside more money to cover bad loans.
